text: There are three ways to reach Google
to get help with their products:
phone support, online support,
and the Google Community help forums.

If you call Google's
customer-support number, shown here,

you'll be confronted with
an automated menu system.

Most of the time, you will
encounter a recorded voice

directing you to a website
to try to resolve your issue.
In some instances,
you may be connected to a human
customer-service representative,
who may help you with your issue.
Google's online support consists of
a collection of articles
that address commonly encountered issues.

To access these articles,
follow these steps.
First, log in to your Google account,
and then go to Support.google.com.

You can either type your
query into the search bar
or click on one of the common issue topics

from the grid of icons
below the search bar.

Note that you can also
click the little arrow
under the icon grid

to see dozens of other
more specific topics.

Following any of the icon
links takes you to a page

that lists out many of
the more common issues.
You can also utilize the community forums

to pose a question or comb
through various threads.
On the Support.google.com page,
select the icon of the Google product
or service at issue and click it.

On the next page, click
the word "Community."
Scroll down the page,
and you will see multiple categories
with many answered questions.
From here, you can either browse through

to see if your question
has already been asked
or ask your own question.
To ask a question,

scroll down to the bottom
of the featured post section
and click the blue words "Ask now"
to pose a question to the community.
